name: Danny's Grannies Trivia Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text:
Please note: This quiz was written several years ago when punctuation was allowed in Fill in the Blank quizzes. This means you WILL need to include apostrophes in the answer if appropriate.

Hopkins' pals
questions.explanation:
Tony's cronies.

	Anthony Hopkins is the quiz maker's favorite actor.

Tom's bombs.

	Actually, very few of Tom Cruise's films were bombs.

Nick's tricks.

	I thought 48 Hours was Nolte's best movie.

Sally's rallies.

	Sally Field was a recent guest star on ER.

questions.text: These are ziplocked to keep Smith's sandwiches fresh.
questions.explanation:
Maggie's baggies.

	She's in the new Harry Potter movie!

Don's prawns.

	Unfortunately there ain't much to say about Don Johnson's recent work.

Mary's dairies.

	MTM was terrific in Ordinary People (Best Picture 1980).

Kiefer's reefers.

	He was going to marry Julia Roberts at one point. Kiefer Sutherland is good at playing villains (A Few Good Men).

Liz's quizzes.

	Remember Liz in Father of the Bride? So beautiful!

questions.text: OK. This is a bit harder: Foster's flatterers.
questions.explanation:
Jodie's toadies.

	She was great in Silence of the Lambs and Nell, too.

questions.text: If Clinton were a cross-dresser (or if he lived in colonial times or had on a fancy tuxedo shirt), you might see these.
questions.explanation:
Bill's frills.

	Hope this isn't too disrespectful, Mr. Former-Prez!

Al's gals.

	He was sublime in The Godfather.

questions.text: Streep's library cubicles. Another harder one.
questions.explanation:
Meryl's carrels.

	She was exquisite in Sophie's Choice and A Cry in the Dark.

Bruce's juices.

	Demi's ex was fantastic in the Die Hard movies and Pulp Fiction (if you can deal with the violence).

questions.text: Here's another hard one. Carey's outcasts.
questions.explanation:
Mariah's pariahs.

	Mariah Carey's singles usually top the pop charts. Does anyone know anything about the 'exhaustion' she's suffering as of August 2001?

Rosie's cozies & Rosie's cosies.

	Rosie's a great talk show host. A tea cozy (or cosy) is a quilted gizmo that keeps hot the tea inside the pot.

questions.text: A hard one: Moore's undershirt. The second word is singular.
questions.explanation:
Demi's chemise.

	Demi is pronounced da MEE. A chemise is a flimsy little undershirt for ladies.

questions.text: Dylan holds these while crunching on corn kernels.
questions.explanation:
Bob's cobs.

	Did you ever hear the sound track to Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid? It's terrific. My favorite Dylan song is Lay Lady Lay.

Jackie's lackeys.

	It's rumored that Jackie didn't like her son John to fly planes.

Andie's dandies.

	Andie was also wonderful in Groundhog Day. 'Dandies' is an old-fashioned term for young men who are social butterflies and take great pains with their clothing.

Molly's collies.

	She was part of the Brat Pack, right? She was good in Sixteen Candles and The Breakfast Club. Maybe she'll have a comeback--who knows?

Reese's fleeces.

	Reese is wonderfully evil in Election with Matthew Broderick.

Steve's sleeves.

	Steve Guttenberg was also great in Diner and The Bedroom Window. If you haven't seen 'em, rent 'em!

Roddy's bodies.

	Roddy McDowall was a child actor (also appeared in How Green Was My Valley). As a young man he starred The Loved One (which also concerned corpses).

Cate's traits.

	She was also in The Talented Mr. Ripley.
